meanings.definition: To assign a lower rating or value to something.
meanings.sent1: I will downrate this movie because it was not very exciting.
meanings.sent2: She decided to downrate the restaurant after receiving poor service.
meanings.sent3: I don't want to downrate your efforts, but there is room for improvement.
meanings.sent4: The judge had to downrate the performance due to multiple mistakes.
meanings.sent5: It's important to downrate products that do not meet expectations.

meanings.definition: To decrease the rating or value of something.
meanings.sent1: The company had to downrate their stocks after the market crash.
meanings.sent2: He chose to downrate the hotel based on the cleanliness of the rooms.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally downrated the recipe by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent4: The storm's impact will downrate the value of the property.
meanings.sent5: Make sure to downrate any items that are damaged or defective.

meanings.sent1: It's not fair to downrate someone's work without understanding the effort.
meanings.sent2: She tends to downrate any new ideas presented to her.
meanings.sent3: I didn't mean to downrate your opinion, I just have a different perspective.
meanings.sent4: The coach had to downrate the team's performance in order to motivate them.
meanings.sent5: Try not to downrate others based on their appearance.
